segment.source: SupportedGrammarLanguages
segment.target: SupportedGrammarLanguages

segment.source: Language
segment.target: Language

segment.source: Here, we enumerate the languages installed on a system, identify which is the default language, and select a different language for recognition.
segment.target: Here, we enumerate the languages installed on a system, identify which is the default language, and select a different language for recognition.

segment.source: Prerequisites:
segment.target: Prerequisites:

segment.source: This topic builds on Speech recognition.
segment.target: This topic builds on Speech recognition.

segment.source: You should have a basic understanding of speech recognition and recognition constraints.
segment.target: You should have a basic understanding of speech recognition and recognition constraints.

segment.source: If you're new to developing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, have a look through these topics to get familiar with the technologies discussed here.
segment.target: If you're new to developing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, have a look through these topics to get familiar with the technologies discussed here.

segment.source: Create your first app
segment.target: Create your first app

segment.source: Learn about events with Events and routed events overview
segment.target: Learn about events with Events and routed events overview

segment.source: User experience guidelines:
segment.target: User experience guidelines:

segment.source: For helpful tips about designing a useful and engaging speech-enabled app, see Speech design guidelines .
segment.target: For helpful tips about designing a useful and engaging speech-enabled app, see Speech design guidelines .

segment.source: Identify the default language
segment.target: Identify the default language

segment.source: A speech recognizer uses the system speech language as its default recognition language.
segment.target: A speech recognizer uses the system speech language as its default recognition language.

segment.source: This language is set by the user on the device Settings System Speech Speech Language screen.
segment.target: This language is set by the user on the device Settings System Speech Speech Language screen.

segment.source: We identify the default language by checking the SystemSpeechLanguage static property.
segment.target: We identify the default language by checking the SystemSpeechLanguage static property.

segment.source: Confirm an installed language
segment.target: Confirm an installed language

segment.source: Installed languages can vary between devices.
segment.target: Installed languages can vary between devices.

segment.source: You should verify the existence of a language if you depend on it for a particular constraint.
segment.target: You should verify the existence of a language if you depend on it for a particular constraint.

segment.source: Note A reboot is required after a new language pack is installed.
segment.target: Note A reboot is required after a new language pack is installed.

segment.source: An exception with error code SPERR\_NOT\_FOUND (0x8004503a) is raised if the specified language is not supported or has not finished installing.
segment.target: An exception with error code SPERR\_NOT\_FOUND (0x8004503a) is raised if the specified language is not supported or has not finished installing.

segment.source: Determine the supported languages on a device by checking one of two static properties of the SpeechRecognizer class:
segment.target: Determine the supported languages on a device by checking one of two static properties of the SpeechRecognizer class:

segment.source: SupportedTopicLanguages—The collection of Language objects used with predefined dictation and web search grammars.
segment.target: SupportedTopicLanguages—The collection of Language objects used with predefined dictation and web search grammars.

segment.source: SupportedGrammarLanguages—The collection of Language objects used with a list constraint or a Speech Recognition Grammar Specification (SRGS) file.
segment.target: SupportedGrammarLanguages—The collection of Language objects used with a list constraint or a Speech Recognition Grammar Specification (SRGS) file.

segment.source: Specify a language
segment.target: Specify a language

segment.source: To specify a language, pass a Language object in the SpeechRecognizer constructor.
segment.target: To specify a language, pass a Language object in the SpeechRecognizer constructor.

segment.source: Here, we specify "en-US" as the recognition language.
segment.target: Here, we specify "en-US" as the recognition language.

segment.source: Remarks
segment.target: Remarks

segment.source: A topic constraint can be configured by adding a SpeechRecognitionTopicConstraint to the Constraints collection of the SpeechRecognizer and then calling CompileConstraintsAsync.
segment.target: A topic constraint can be configured by adding a SpeechRecognitionTopicConstraint to the Constraints collection of the SpeechRecognizer and then calling CompileConstraintsAsync.

segment.source: A SpeechRecognitionResultStatus of TopicLanguageNotSupported is returned if the recognizer is not initialized with a supported topic language.
segment.target: A SpeechRecognitionResultStatus of TopicLanguageNotSupported is returned if the recognizer is not initialized with a supported topic language.

segment.source: A list constraint is configured by adding a SpeechRecognitionListConstraint to the Constraints collection of the SpeechRecognizer and then calling CompileConstraintsAsync.
segment.target: A list constraint is configured by adding a SpeechRecognitionListConstraint to the Constraints collection of the SpeechRecognizer and then calling CompileConstraintsAsync.

segment.source: You cannot specify the language of a custom list directly.
segment.target: You cannot specify the language of a custom list directly.

segment.source: Instead, the list will be processed using the language of the recognizer.
segment.target: Instead, the list will be processed using the language of the recognizer.

segment.source: An SRGS grammar is an open-standard XML format represented by the SpeechRecognitionGrammarFileConstraint class.
segment.target: An SRGS grammar is an open-standard XML format represented by the SpeechRecognitionGrammarFileConstraint class.

segment.source: Unlike custom lists, you can specify the language of the grammar in the SRGS markup.
segment.target: Unlike custom lists, you can specify the language of the grammar in the SRGS markup.

segment.source: CompileConstraintsAsync fails with a SpeechRecognitionResultStatus of TopicLanguageNotSupported if the recognizer is not initialized to the same language as the SRGS markup.
segment.target: CompileConstraintsAsync fails with a SpeechRecognitionResultStatus of TopicLanguageNotSupported if the recognizer is not initialized to the same language as the SRGS markup.
